scenario_text.value:
(I know Dracumon said to leave Kaito alone,
but I’m worried about him.)

(Ahh... There he goes. And Dracumon’s watching
him from a distance.)
Yah!!!
Ugh... Damn it... Miu!
If only... If only I’d been stronger! Miu!

(Kaito just keeps slamming his fist into the
wall.)

(Kaito cared about Miu so much. Always
looking out for her, protecting her.)

(And despite that, she was taken away in an
instant...)

(The moment he acknowledged her independence
and let his guard down, no less.)

(...I see him suffering, but what can I do
for him?)

(I can’t imagine he’ll welcome whatever I do.
Not sure how to handle this.)
(What can I do for Kaito?)
Watch and wait.
Get out of here.
Talk to him.

(Nothing I say to Kaito will get through to
him at this point.)
(Dracumon said as much, and I believe him.)
(...Guess I should just watch and wait.)

Thanks for taking Kaito’s feelings into
account, Takuma.

(...This was a bad idea. I just don’t know
what to say to him when he’s like this.)

(What Kaito needs right now, what we all need
right now, is time.)

Thanks for taking Kaito’s feelings into
account, Takuma.
Uh, hey, Kaito...

(No response... Guess he doesn’t feel like
chatting now.)
Hey, Takuma. Over here.
Right, okay.

Sorry, man, but I don’t think he has it in
him to talk right now.)
Dracumon...

I’m sticking around and keeping an eye on
him, it’s just...

I’d appreciate it if you checked in like this
from time to time.
Yeah, right.
(I’m sorry, Kaito. We’ll have to talk later.)
